intro: Erica alopecurus var. glabriflora, commonly known as the smooth-flowered heath, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in coastal or heathland environments. It is often found in regions with cool, moist climates, such as parts of southern Africa and the Mediterranean. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
